instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U8900: What is U8900? This chip creates the GPU power rails on the 820-3332 board to the 2012 and early 2013 15‚Äù Retina Macbook Pros. It becomes desoldered and is the cause of no video and kernel panics/crashes in that model most of the time..
definitions.PPVCORE_GPU: What is PPVCORE_GPU? This is the main power rail for the GPU. This is required for the GPU to turn on so you can get image on the display. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> had no video at first. Heated GPU some and video returned. After GPU replacement I had chime backlight and video again but red distortion in the background and osx wouldn't fully load. At first reflowed VRAM but then no video. After reballing all vrams I still have no backlight or video but it still chimes.

Not missing any components around vram.  Could the vram gone bad or possibly something else? Also applied leaded solder to <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> to rule it out but no change

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Did you try <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> first? Did you remove the VRAM glue when doing the GPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message:
Yes tried <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> first.

Did not remove glue from vram before GPU replacement which is why I  reballed them afterwards when i noticed the red artifacts

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: If Samsung vRAM, probably got bad...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Yeah could be bad VRAM now

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Hynix VRAM. Will try new Vram

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: All VRAM was replaced along with <CHIP>U8900</CHIP> but still no image or backlight on screen and 0V on <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_GPU</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no video
threads.message: Bad GPU bad VRAM bad CPU bad internal trace. Sounds like a waste of time.
